meanings.definition: The highest or uppermost stone in a structure.
meanings.sent1: The topstone of the castle tower was the largest stone.
meanings.sent2: The mason carefully placed the topstone on the wall.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to balance on the topstone of the wall.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was the topstone of her beauty, shining brightly.
meanings.sent5: The topstone of the pyramid gleamed in the sunlight, marking the pinnacle of the structure.

meanings.definition: A stone placed on top of something as a finishing touch.
meanings.sent1: The topstone on the cake was a sugary flower.
meanings.sent2: The architect added a decorative topstone to the building.
meanings.sent3: The children carefully placed the topstone on their sandcastle.
meanings.sent4: The final brushstroke was the topstone of the artist's masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The topstone on the fence post added a charming detail to the garden.

meanings.definition: A stone used as a cap or cover for a wall or structure.
meanings.sent1: The topstone protected the wall from rain and wind.
meanings.sent2: The ancient ruins still had the topstone intact.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat knocked off the topstone from the garden wall.
meanings.sent4: The topstone on the well kept the water clean and safe.
meanings.sent5: The topstone on the chimney prevented birds from nesting inside.
